alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Henry; Mercer; Putnam; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 9:31PM CST until February 18 at 10:30PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Rock Island County in northwestern Illinois... Northern Putnam County in north central Illinois... Northeastern Mercer County in northwestern Illinois... Whiteside County in northwestern Illinois... Henry County in northwestern Illinois... Bureau County in north central Illinois... * Until 1030 PM CST. * At 930 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Dixon to Montpelier, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 72. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 2 and 33. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 44. Interstate 280 between mile markers 11 and 18. Interstate 180 between mile markers 1 and 13. Locations impacted include... Moline, Rock Island, East Moline, Sterling, Kewanee, Rock Falls, Princeton, Morrison, Cambridge, Hennepin, Silvis, Geneseo, Spring Valley, Milan, Colona, Camanche, Coal Valley, Galva, Prophetstown and Hampton. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on your headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.

area.areaDesc: Bureau; Henry; Mercer; Putnam; Rock Island; Whiteside
